Name: Hatmehit
Description: The fish deity Hatmehit was principally revered at her sanctuary in the Delta, Mendes. She was usually depicted as a fish or as a woman with a fish emblem on her head. The goddess is wearing a long close-fitting dress with a uraeus frieze and a fish standard on her head. Her right hand holds an ankh-sign in her lap, the left is holding her bare breast. Hatmehit is seated on a throne, the sides of which have been decorated with a feathered pattern. On the back of the throne is the sema-sign. The knob on the back of the figure has been pierced through horizontally.
